noun.description: The standard of something as measured against other things of a similar kind; the degree of excellence of something.
examples: the hospital ranks in the top tier in quality of care

noun.description: A distinctive attribute or characteristic possessed by someone or something.

origin: Middle English (in the senses character, disposition and particular property or feature): from Old French qualite, from Latin qualitas (translating Greek poiotēs), from qualis of what kind, of such a kind.
